column4: Can someone help me connect my Rogers highspeed to my newly installed Ubuntu? I'm very noob with this
dsl ? connected directly to your computer ?
your router shouldhve the conneciton info in it , you should only have to plug your computer in the router,  there shouldn't be any issues
are you blocking ports in your router ?
sorry i got disconnected, i was trying to say it tells me im connected but wont show any websites
did you try accessing the router from ubuntu ? through firefox ? did you try another internet application like chat ?
yes i tried firefox and some simple games, none will connect
did you try login into your router ?
I dont have any security, and my windows xp laptop works fine when wired to the router
it also blocks my wireless connection to the laptop when connected to ubuntu
does your router use dynamic ip addresses or do you have to assing static ips to each comp?
maybe you should lookup your router model in the forum to see if there are any issues,  I'Ve pretty much run thru every easy thing I can think of
im noob, how can i find out about my ip on the router?
just out of curiosity,  does your ISP supply the router, or did you buy it yourself ?
i bought it
ok so taht rules out your ISP locking the router for only one computer,
thanks ill see what i can find in the forums and ill call my isp and router manufacturer
ok I suggest you read your router's documentation but if you did nothing more then plug it in when you bought it , there shouldnT' be anything in there to keep you from  connecting
I donT think your isp is at fault,  even if it is rogers
ha ha alright thanks
pay attention to macogw  he seems to know a little something
